results.title: Fish
results.creator_credit: Denis Harvey, Martin Didsbury and Television New Zealand
results.brief_description: Introduces the labour intensive processing of raw fish into a range of consumer products including quality control and the impact of modern technology upon the industry.

results.title: Beer
results.creator_credit: Denis Harvey, Martin Didsbury and Television New Zealand
results.brief_description: Presents an examination of beer production. Indicates the processing stages, and the resulting outputs of products, by-products and wastes. Chemical processes in fermentation are also considered. The program lends itself to students developing a flow chart of the manufacturing system, with inputs of various values, quantities and types.

results.title: My brother Jack
results.creator_credit: Daryl Wayland and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: Part one: Presents an interview with Jack Johnston’s wife and daughter to provide a background to the novel “My brother Jack”. Part Two: Features John Barnes of La Trobe University discussing the main issues raised in the book.

results.title: 1984 [a discussion]
results.brief_description: Considers George Orwell’s classic text “1984”. Provides an exposition of Owell’s basic themes together with a consideration of his intention to warn against tendencies he saw in society and an assessment of their realization compared with Huxley’s grim warning in “Brave New World”

results.title: Accomplished women
results.creator_credit: Jerry Kramer, Charles Braverman and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Six women, including Helen Reddy, who have made it to the top in their chosen fields discuss a wide range of topics from politics to personal feelings. Highlights changing attitudes of women about themselves. The other women include Shirley Chisholm (Member of the US Congress), La Donna Harris (Founder - Americans for Indian Opportunity), Katherine Graham (Business woman - Washington Post), Nikki Giovanni (Poet), Virginia Apgar (Pediatrics specialist).

results.title: Jack Frost
results.brief_description: Filmed in Russia, this feature-length production of the tale of Jack frost involves many stock characters such as an ugly witch, a cruel stepmother, a long suffering husband, an obnoxious daughter, a mistreated stepdaughter and of course, the “handsome prince”. The prince is in the form of a vain young man who subsequently abandons his narcissistic ways. Originally in Russian; dubbed into English. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: What is PKU?
results.creator_credit: Deptartment of Audio Visual Communications, Glaxo Australia
results.brief_description: PKU is an accumulation of phenylalanine in the blood, which if left unchecked, will cause intellectual disability. Stresses the importance of diet in controlling this disorder.

results.title: Bilingual kids
results.creator_credit: James Mann and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This program is designed to introduce teachers, parents and communities to the concept of bilingual education. It looks at processes involved in the implementation of the Greek:English Bilingual Pilot Project in the Richmond-Collingwood area. A number of evaluation findings are also discussed

results.title: Better life than them
results.creator_credit: Sally Ingleton and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A group of 15 year olds are interviewed about their attitudes towards school, employment and unemployment and life expectations, peer group acceptance, short and long term prospects of jobs and careers.
